meanings.definition: Material used to fill in gaps or spaces
meanings.sent1: The infill was a soft clay that easily filled the cracks.
meanings.sent2: The construction worker used infill to patch up the holes in the wall.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat thought the infill was a new type of toy.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like infill, filling the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The infill resembled putty, molding perfectly into the crevices.

meanings.definition: The act of filling in gaps or spaces
meanings.sent1: The infill of the puzzle piece completed the picture.
meanings.sent2: His infill of the missing words made the story whole again.
meanings.sent3: The infill of whipped cream on the cake looked like a fluffy cloud.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was the infill that brought the team together.
meanings.sent5: The infill of colors brightened up the dull painting.

meanings.definition: The process of adding new buildings to existing urban areas
meanings.sent1: The city planner discussed the infill to accommodate the growing population.
meanings.sent2: The community welcomed the infill of modern apartments in the downtown area.
meanings.sent3: The infill of skyscrapers made the city skyline look like a futuristic movie set.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were the infill that revitalized the old neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The infill of green spaces transformed the urban jungle into a peaceful oasis.
